description: From the Latin ēmendātus (“corrected”), the perfect passive participle of ēmendō (“I free from faults, correct”).

verbs.description: emendate (third-person singular simple present emendates, present participle emendating, simple past and past participle emendated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) Remove errors and corruptions from (a text); to emend (a text).
